Posts.Content: volleymom77 wrote: Wednesday went for mammogram and ultrasound found two inch mass and 1 cm lymph node. Surgeon and Radiologist both are women doctors told me it was cancer. Biopsy of just the large tumour with marker placement was Friday waiting to see what kind. They say I will do chemo first, and still have to have a marker placed in lymph node and MRI to see if its in my chest wall. Is there any chance they are wrong? I have fourteen year old twin girls and a 28 year old daughter. I am fifty years young please advice. Dx 11/15/2012, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/1 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 12/6/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: volleymom77 wrote: Ugh, I began this journey 11/7 with mammogram and ultrasound - told its cancer - biopsy 11/9 they where going to do breast,nipple, and lymph node but they changed their minds only did breast - told me I would be very sore if the did all three and the risks with the nipple to great. 11/15 the phone call its cancer for sure meeting next day 11/16 told need lots more tests,its a fairly aggressive estrogen and progesterone negative and still waiting for Her2. Plus one of my staging samples was too small so I could be grade 3 doc said she looks at it has 2.5 ugh. 11/19 lymph node biopsy with marker placement the node is 2.5 cm. 11/21 Bone Scan and Ct with barium. 11/26 mri with contrast both breasts. 12/3 meet with cancer doctor doesn't this seem like a long time.Plus they think it could be Pagets. Dx 11/15/2012, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/1 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 12/6/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: December 2012 chemo group beckstar18 Bren58

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2013 06:32PM volleymom77 wrote: 1st hospitalization was dehydration stayed three days then doc did start to schedule me for fluids and Neulasta shot 2nd hospitalization was after third chemo turned out to be the flu B and yes I had my flu shot, however they believed it was meningitis so I had to have a spinal tap too, and two pints of blood for low red blood cells was in the hospital for one week every one had to wear masks when they came in my room. The worst was the head ache doc gave me oxycodone never had it before and it barely helped my headache. So be careful luckily no one in my family got the flu just me. So hopeful all will be better this time, honestly I am more nervous about my surgery should be some time in May. Then radiation plus herceptin.

Hope tomorrow is better. Found a fun shirt to wear, its pink and says Attitude Downloading...... Think positive . Now I know I must be sedated or twilight for anything to do with my skinny veins. Hope all is bearable in your world....
